fields.description:
h3. Summary
When running the REST API call *api/2/project/\{projectIdOrKey}/role* on a Software Project, results related to Service Desk are returned. 
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup JIRA Software 
# Add Service Desk app
# Create Software project TEST
# Run GET {{/api/2/project/TEST/role}}

h3. Expected Results
Expecting only Roles that appear in the project to show up

h3. Actual Results
Below are the results for a Software Project:
{noformat}
{
  "Service Desk Team": "http://localhost:8080/demo/rest/api/2/project/10000/role/10101",
  "Developers": "http://localhost:8080/demo/rest/api/2/project/10000/role/10102",
  "Service Desk Customers": "http://localhost:8080/demo/rest/api/2/project/10000/role/10100",
  "Administrators": "http://localhost:8080/demo/rest/api/2/project/10000/role/10002"
}
{noformat}
Service Desk Team, Developers & Service Desk Customers should not be appearing

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: api/2/project/{projectIdOrKey}/role returns unexpected results

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, if users use any validator in *Create* transition which set required field and tried to split issue, the action will fail.

+Steps to reproduce+

# Install JIRA Suite Utitlies
# Edit workflow of any project and edit the *Create* transition.
# In the *Create* transition, add a validator that set specific field as required.
# Go to board and try to split issues from backlog.

By default, JIRA only ship with the following 2 validators for *Create* transition:

{code}
Permission Validator
User Permission Validator
{code}

Split feature fails since the required feature is part of third party plugin.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.6.2, JIRA 7.7.0


h3. Expected Results

Split feature creates new issue while copying the required field from the parent issue.


h3. Actual Results

Split feature fails to create new issue due to the missing required field value.


h3.Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Improve Issue Split Function

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When you close a sprint in the web interface, and it contains issues that were not completed, then you are prompted to then tell Jira Software where to place those incomplete issues (ie. to the backlog, into an existing future planned sprint, or possibly create a new sprint to add these issues to that).
 However with the current REST API, you can not use any parameter into the endpoint
{noformat}
/rest/agile/1.0/sprint/{sprintId}{noformat}
that would allow you to do this when closing the sprint via REST call.  See [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-sprint-sprintId-put] for complete parameters that are valid for this call.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be helpful if the REST API was updated for Agile/Software to include this as a possible option
h3. Why this is important

It would be helpful for integration/automations that handle sprint management to be able to do this same function that end users using the web gui can perform.
fields.summary: When closing a sprint via the REST API, you should be able to indicate where to place the incomplete issues in the sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When we're following the documentation to establish a communication between Jira and GitHub, there's no statement describing a few differences as the one where we don't have an option to "Create Branches" between Jira and GitHub, but we have this feature between Jira and Bitbucket.

h3. Suggestion
As the lack of this information can lead to a confusion about what should be displayed under the development panel, it would be nice to have a clarification regarding this matter.
fields.summary: Improve server documentation regarding Jira to Github by clarifying that Jira does not display "Create Branch" under development panel

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, the Priority field shows an arrow pointing up in a different color, depending on the priority - Red = Critical, Orange = high, yellow is Medium, etc.

 

It is not easy to see the different colors, even for those of us NOT color-blind.  And printing to a non-color printer will not show the priority differences.  

 

Allow me (the admin) or me (the end user) to configure how I want this field to display - either to display the symbol (as it does now) or the actual field value (Critical, High, etc) as it displays when you export to CSV (or other) format.
fields.summary: Allow Priority field to display the actual value rather than a colored arrow

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce

# Go to a board (instance: Bulldog)
# Click an issue X, so the 'detail view' pops up on the right
# Write a comment, don't save it
# Right-click an issue Y on the board, e.g. to copy issue URL

h2. Expected result

Issue X is in detail view, comment is still in 'edit' mode

h2. Actual result

Issue Y is in detail mode, comment is lost :(

This is particularly annoying, as:

* Description or any other field in 'detail mode' is 'inline' editable and saved upon navigating away
* Any other comment or page where you navigate away from something you're editing has a 'Are you sure you want to navigate away? You'll lose your things'
* Right-click should not trigger another issue to get focused/become detail-moded

I've lost data, and this sucks big time.

NB this was on version 7.8.0-RELEASE-BDOG-2815, but had to select an affected version below (so chose 7.7.0 Server)
fields.summary: Right-click on issue on a board focuses the issue, losing any comment you're typing :(

fields.summary: Swimlane name needs to switch faster when scrolling on sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customer notifications are not rendering text formating correctly and it's sending as a plain text with some pieces of the code
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure the "User Default Settings" ([http://JIRA_URL/secure/admin/ViewUserDefaultSettings.jspa|http://jira_url/secure/admin/ViewUserDefaultSettings.jspa]) to use HTML as the "Default outgoing email format"
 # Edit a description field and add some colors and formatting to the text like the example below:
{code:java}
{color:#14892c}*Acceptance Criteria:*{color}

 1. testing 123
----
{color:#654982}*Development and Testing Artifacts:*{color}
{code}

h3. Expected Results

According to our documentation ([Configuring renderers - Implications for JIRA operations|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/configuring-renderers-861253418.html#Configuringrenderers-implicationsImplicationsforJIRAoperations]) when using the Atlassian wiki renderer, the rendered content (i.e. exactly what you see on the 'View Issue' page) will be sent out in the emails. This will create emails which are as rich as the content makes it. 
If using the wiki style renderer, this is the preferred type of email since it is a real representation of the wiki markup.

!Screen Shot 2018-01-19 at 3.29.16 PM.png!
h3. Actual Results

We'll get the email notification without the text being formatted

!Screen Shot 2018-01-19 at 3.24.16 PM.png!
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Outgoing mail notification is not rendering the text correctly

fields.description: It appears we can only use "split issue" when viewing in the backlog view. We have the scenario where, during sprint review, the team decides that they want to split an issue into smaller pieces, but they cannot do it from that view and it has to be deferred until after the meeting. It would be helpful if we could split the issue, right as we're looking at it.

fields.description:
Splitting issues in a Scrum Board with 'Original Time Estimate' as estimation statistic throws 'Uncaught TypeError'.
h2.  How to reproduce
 # Create or navigate to an existing scrum board that uses 'Original Time Estimate' as estimation statistic
 # Right-click an issue in the backlog and select 'Split Issue'
 # On the prompt that pops up, type a value on the 'Estimate' field of the first issue (even if it already has a value)
 # Click on another part of the screen or tab to the next field

h2. Expected results
 - No error occurs

h2. Actual results
 - The following error is displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-17 at 5.03.57 PM.png|thumbnail!

h2. Workarounds
 - None

h2. Comments

The error doesn't prevent the issue from being split. The error message can be closed/ignored.
fields.summary: Splitting issues in a Scrum Board with 'Original Time Estimate' as estimation statistic throws 'Uncaught TypeError'.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

DVCS: sync is broken for Github Enterprise when an organization is deleted
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # goto Github Enterprise, create OAuth credentials for the user;
 # create 2 organizations with a repo in each;
 # add the organizations, one by one, to DVCS;
 # goto Github Enterprise, delete an organization;
 # wait until the next hourly sync

h3. Expected Results

The sync should complete successfully
h3. Actual Results

The sync fails and any subsequent sync jobs fail as well. The following error is thrown in {{atlassian-jira.log}}
{noformat}
2017-11-24 22:03:33,188 Caesium-1-3 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.scheduler.core.JobLauncher] Scheduled job with ID 'com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.scheduler.DvcsScheduler:job' failed
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.exception.SourceControlException: Error retrieving list of repositories
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.spi.github.GithubCommunicator.getRepositories(GithubCommunicator.java:214)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.remote.CachingCommunicator.getRepositories(CachingCommunicator.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.RepositoryServiceImpl.syncRepositoryList(RepositoryServiceImpl.java:205)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.RepositoryServiceImpl.syncRepositoryList(RepositoryServiceImpl.java:262)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.scheduler.DvcsSchedulerJobRunner.syncOrganizations(DvcsSchedulerJobRunner.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.scheduler.DvcsSchedulerJobRunner.runJob(DvcsSchedulerJobRunner.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse(JobLauncher.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.launchJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:443)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeClusteredJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:438)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeClusteredJobWithRecoveryGuard(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:462)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeQueuedJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:390)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:285)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:282)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeJob(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeNextJob(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.run(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:34)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: org.eclipse.egit.github.core.client.RequestException: Not Found (404)
	at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.client.GitHubClient.createException(GitHubClient.java:552)
	at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.client.GitHubClient.get(GitHubClient.java:740)
	at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.client.PageIterator.next(PageIterator.java:173)
	at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.service.GitHubService.getAll(GitHubService.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.service.RepositoryService.getRepositories(RepositoryService.java:242)
	... 18 more
{noformat}
This bug is related to JSWSERVER-14268 but deals with deleted organizations rather than forked repositories.
h3. Workaround:
 # Run following SQL command and copy the values of NAME and HOST_URL fields in next steps -
 *If connected to Github Enterprise use this query:*
{code:sql}
SELECT "NAME", "HOST_URL"
FROM "AO_E8B6CC_ORGANIZATION_MAPPING"
WHERE "DVCS_TYPE" = 'githube';
{code}
*If connected to* *Github Cloud use this query:*
{code:sql}
SELECT "NAME", "HOST_URL"
FROM "AO_E8B6CC_ORGANIZATION_MAPPING"
WHERE "DVCS_TYPE" = 'github';
{code}
 # For each record returned by above SQL command, run following curl commands using valid user credentials that have access to corresponding org/user account -
{code:sh}
curl -u <GITHUB_USER> -H 'Accept:application/json' '<HOST_URL>/api/v3/orgs/<NAME>/repos?per_page=100&page=1'
{code}
(i) Replace <HOST_URL> and <NAME> with values of "HOST_URL" and "NAME" fields respectively in SQL command output. (i)
 # Take any of the organizations that return the following response: 
{code:java}
 {'message': 'Not Found'}{code}
 # Validate that they _do not exist_ on the Github Enterprise server
 # Navigate to *Settings >> Applications >> DVCS Accounts >> <Organization Name from step 4> ... (3-dots menu) >**>> Delete*
fields.summary: DVCS: sync is broken for Github Enterprise when an organization is deleted

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If user select French language and a Sprint contains the single issue, JIRA will show that the Sprint contains 11 issues (11 demande).

+Steps to reproduce+

# Create a Sprint in backlog.
# Add a single issue to the Sprint.
# Change the language of JIRA to Frech from general configuration page.
# Refresh backlog.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.6.2


h3. Expected Results

JIRA shows 1 issues for the Sprint.


h3. Actual Results

JIRA shows 11 issues for the Sprint: (11 demande)


h3.Workaround

None. For now, please select English language to view the accurate remaining issues in Sprint (from backlog view)
fields.summary: Backlog showing 11 issues in Sprint instead of 1 issue if JIRA is using French language

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In kanban and Scrum Boards, while inputing data to a field in the Issue Details Pane, such as a comment, as an inline edit, if a Rank operation is performed the page is refreshed which causes a set focus event to exit the field and the data being entered is lost.

h3. Suggested Solution
Either:
* Allow admins to disable the auto refresh on boards that are causing the input variable to be lost
* OR Very Similar to the Feature Request https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9292 which is to preserve persistent comment history so that if a field entry is lost mid chain a recovery option is available natively
 
h3. Workaround
Is the same as JRASERVER-9292:
This can be worked around by third-party browser plugins such as Lazarus Form Recovery that save the form data in a database in the browser.

Google Chrome: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/lazarus-form-recovery/loljledaigphbcpfhfmgopdkppkifgno?hl=en

Mozilla Firefox: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-GB/firefox/addon/lazarus-form-recovery/
fields.summary: Page refresh on rank causes loss of inline edit field input variables

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If completing a sprint takes longer than 60 seconds one will experience a timeout message similar to the following:
 !release_timeout.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* Bulk editing large amount of issues ( 200+ ) takes longer than 60 seconds

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a large number of issues in a sprint ( 200+ )
# Use remote fields, other customizations, or poor performance that results in bulk editing these issues to take longer than 60 seconds
# Attempt to complete sprint, receive error message


h3. Expected Results
A more descriptive error message is displayed like the one we implemented for Kanban boards, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11775

h3. Actual Results
A generic timeout error is displayed
 
h3. Notes
Even though a timeout error is displayed the process does continue and issues within the sprint are completed successfully
fields.summary: Timeout errors can occur when completing sprints in Scrum boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Many of our customers are using modern versions of Linux distributions that come missing some of the system fonts that used to be packaged with older distributions of Linux.
Also many of our customers are moving to use AWS headless VMs or Docker containers that might not have all the X11 fonts installed.
JIRA has a dependency on some system fonts that would be needed to properly render various charts on server side and send them over to be displayed on the client browser.

Currently the JIRA font dependencies are not clearly documented especially the fonts needed to be existing on the JIRA hosting server to allow charts to render correctly.

h3. Suggested Solution
Please provide more documentation in JIRA supported platform on the font dependencies from JIRA hosting server side.
This would be the required fonts to allow JIRA to render all built-in charts without running into fonts issues.
This kind of list should belong to JIRA supported platform list.


h3. Why this is important
Should allow customers to install the needed fonts in case those fonts are missing from their system.
 
h3. Workaround 
Currently the work around we have is to document individual cases in KBs, but it would be much better to have a formal supported platform section for fonts.
fields.summary: JIRA server Font dependancies

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
To allow users to configure board listed under projects. When Project A is added to the board filter, Jira will automatically list the board inside the project under Project A.
 !board list.png|thumbnail! 
 
If the users having a lot of filters which mention a lot of projects, then the Board list will be huge.
 
h3. Suggested Solution
To add a setting to Hide or Show board listed under Board list inside the project
 
h3. Workaround 
Currently, the is no workaround
fields.summary: As a user I want to allow to configure (Hide/Show) board list under project

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We recently opened GHS-102725 because JIRA would delete any in-draft comments whenever another user changed the board state.  It was suggested that limitations with how JAVA based applications communicate with web-browsers make a proper fix impossible.  

If this is the case then please allow system administrators the option to turn off the auto-update feature and return to how this was handled pre-JIRA 7.
 - Do not auto-refresh boards
 - Inform the user when the board state has changed
 - Allow the user to CHOOSE when to refresh the board so that no work is lost.
fields.summary: Option to stop boards board from auto-refreshing since it deletes in-draft edits

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Jira only take into account of completed stories while calculating the Sprint Velocity:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/velocity-chart-938845700.html

{quote}
You can estimate your team's velocity based on the total Estimate (for all *completed stories*) for each recent sprint. 
{quote}

However, in some scenarios, some stories were worked on another Sprint and completed in another Sprint. It'll be more accurate if the Velocity Chart calculation includes issues which are not completed but worked on (logged time).


h3. Suggested Solution

Include issues which are not completed but worked on (logged time) while calculating Velocity Chart.


h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Velocity Chart should include amount of work done on incomplete stories

fields.description:
Originally reported via the AUI project in [AUI-4211|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AUI-4211], but it's a feature request for Jira Software.

---

An updated timestamp make it look as if I've been working on the issue, but I haven't.

Similarly, I might not want to send email notifications just because I drag around a couple of co-worker's issues on a shared Agile Board.

If I move an Issue vertically in an Agile board, the only thing changed is the rank.
To me, this is a "non-action", since no actual work has been done on the Issue itself.
So I don't want the Updated timestamp to be changed.
I also want to be able to prevent email notifications to be sent for this minor change to the issue.

When people list issues, they usually sort the results by last Updated and expect to see the issues currently being worked on at the top. Therefore, these non-changes should not update the Updated timestamp.

That's why I'm requesting two configuration options in the Agile Board settings.

(
Note that the above only applies to rank changes using drag n drop in the agile board.
It does not apply to the situation where I open an Issue and choose "Rank to top" or "Rank to bottom".
)

Please add two options to a board's general configuration to control:

{noformat}
...
...
Filter Query: blah blah blah
Ranking: Using rank
[x] Don't change the issue's updated time when changing rank
[x] Don't send notification email when changing rank
Projects in board: blah blah blah
...
...
{noformat}
fields.summary: Don't touch an issue's updated time when only its rank is changed

h4. Summary

In a board's backlog view mode has a long list of sprint and issues, when a user scroll up fast, the backlog view mode will wrongly pin the sprint name in a sprint header

h4. Steps to reproduce
# It's recorded in [here|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CkEzZ5UinNVaXHD8yKTiFZiK85H9UWAN/view?usp=sharing] (unable to attach due to attachment size limit). Make sure the board has long list of issues and sprints
# As you can see, the sprints are in order Sprint 2 > Sprint 3 > followed by Sprint 4 and so on
# From the backlog list, scroll up fast.

h4. Expected Result
The sprint name being pinned in the header should be the sprint whose issues are shown at the top list.

The sprint name being pinned in the header is Sprint 9, while it should be Sprint 6 (as user already started seeing the issues in Sprint 6. The user needs to scroll down until it reaches Sprint 9, and then scroll up slowly to allow the header to show the correct pinned sprint

h4. Workaround
No workaround other than the user has to scroll up slowly. But this is rather inconvenient when user has long list of sprints and issues.
fields.summary: Wrong pinned sprint header when scrolling up fast in backlog view mode

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the ability to create Agile boards in Jira is governed by the *Create Shared Objects* global permission. This same global permission is also used to allow users to share filters and dashboards. However, administrators may wish to allow their general users to create and share filters and dashboard but restrict the ability to create Agile boards to a smaller group.
h3. Suggested Solution

Decouple the sharing of filters/dashboards and creation of Agile boards, possibly through the creation of a separate global permission unique to Jira Software, e.g. *Create Agile Boards.*
h3.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A client has noticed that there are inconsistencies in the due date field from the "activity" panel on the issue view screen. More info in the notes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use an instance with a timezone of GMT+x (say, Amsterdam).
# Log in as a user with the same timezone settings.
# Change the "duedate" to any date - say, the 25th of December.
# On the issue view screen, click on the "Activity" panel - you should see "<USER> changed the Due Date to '25/12/17' on <ISSUE>"
# Change the user timezone - User > Profile > Preferences > click on the "edit" icon, change your timezone to somewhere west of your original timezone say, London - GMT+00) and save.
# Go back to the issue, view "Activity", you will see "<USER> changed the Due Date to '24/12/17' on <ISSUE>".

h3. Expected Results
The due date is expected to always be the same both on the "dates" and the "Activity" panels regardless of the user's timezone.

h3. Actual Results
If the user is in a timezone west of the one configured on the server, the due date in "Activity" is one day less than that in the 'dates' panel
 
h3. Notes
This problem happens because, on a DB level, we are storing a timestamp, not just a date - i.e. rather than storing "2017-12-25", we're also storing the hour, i.e. "2017-12-25 00:00:00". It goes without saying that midnight of any day in Amsterdam is 11 PM of the day before if you're in London, which is why the London user sees the day as the 24th whereas the issue info panel will show the day as the 25th.

h3.Workaround
* You can set all customers' timezone "east" of the server's
* You can set the server's timezone to a place to the west of all users on the system
* You should be able to set the default user timezone east of the server's (haven't verified this one)
fields.summary: Duedate field not consistent between 'dates' panel and 'activity' depending on TZ

fields.description:
It is very frustrating (especially since it happens several times every day) when:

I am on a Jira page (say a bug)

I do not interact with Jira for some time so it logs me out per our corporate time out

I return to the page, attempt to do something but need to log in so I do, but THEN

The browser refreshes to my dashboard (or whatever page it is that I never use). 

Jira should MAINTAIN the page I was on when I was required to log in.

Why would it ever go anywhere else?  Why would it want to frustrate users?
fields.summary: When login state has timed out, refreshing page (including signing in) should KEEP user on that page

fields.description:
Hi,

*Problem*

Each time users that send emails to a designated mailbox from which Jira retrieves them in order to create new tickets or add comments to existing ones usually contain footers with company's logos, marketing imagery or some standard text. All these attachments are autiomatically added to tickets into file attachments therefore cluttering important content.

 

*Goals / solution*

Could we have an option to create filters or a new option in Jira's ticket that allows to remove existing and ignore future content or attachments files in newly retrieved messages? Ideally in files attachments one would click option and select "Remove and ignore" or have a dedicated feature to manageme ignored files and text content that is being removed for each email message going into JIRA. This could be global, per project or even per ticket etc.
fields.summary: Automatically remove and ignore unwanted text content or attachment files in tickets created from emails

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

A client recently contacted support asking if it would be possible to allow users to install and uninstall add-ons without giving them full system administrator permissions, and how.
h3. Suggested Solution

I couldn't really suggest any concrete solutions to speak of other than workarounds (see below). The client was made aware that add-on installation should be restricted to system administrator as it can bring down their entire instance, but they maintain that this is a critical requirement and that add-on installation isn't something that can be entirely delegated to JIRA system administrators.
Ideally, they should be able to be able to allow users to add or remove add-ons regardless of whether they have sysadmin permissions.
h3. Why this is important

The client explained that "basic" JIRA admins need to install (as well as remove) add-ons frequently, even daily, and that delegating all add-on installation to sysadmin staff is not an option.
On the other hand, JIRA admins cannot be given full system administration permissions for security reasons.
h3. Workaround (Optional)

I suggested the following:
 * Giving sysadmin privileges to users who have to install add-ons.
 * Creating a "add-on request" issue type and routing all matching issues to sysadmin staff for them to take care of.

Neither workaround is ideal given the client's requirements, so while I raised a few points about why this can cause problems on their system, I also proposed raising a suggestion ticket for the feature.
fields.summary: Separate add-on installation permission from jira-system-administrators

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating branch from a Jira issue, if the Jira Summary issue is too long (more than 100 characters), the shortened branch name that is suggested which is shorten is still too long. E.g, for a Jira issue (type story): 

Jira Issue Summary: "123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789" (149 characters)

Suggested branch name: RTA-5066-123456789-123456789-123456789-123456789-123456789-123456789-123456789-123456789-123456789 (98 characters)

Suggested prefix: "feature/" (8 characters)

That makes a total length of the suggested branch name of 106, more than the 100 characters allowed for a branch name

This bug will also then lead to the following bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-10433

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Jira issue with a long summary (E.g: 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789)
# From the issue page, click 'Create branch', this should redirect to the create branch page on Bitbucket Server
# On the branch create page, click 'Create' without changing anything (using the suggested branch name and prefix)

h3. Expected Results
Users are able to create a branch on Bitbucket with the suggested branch name

h3. Actual Results
Users won't be able create a branch on Bitbucket with the suggested branch name. Instead, they get the error message "The ref name, once fully qualified, is limited to 100 characters", without any possibility to change the branch name. 

 !lVmhCCSHlq.gif|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Jira "Create branch" feature creates branch name which is too long for Bitbucket

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Kanban boards will show *Done* issues if their *Fix Version* field includes an archived version.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Kanban project with project key *KAN*
# Create a story, *KAN-1.*
# Create a version called *test-version*.
# Edit *KAN-1* and set its *Fix Version* field to *test-version*.
# Archive the version *test-version*.
# Move the story to the *Done* column in the board.
# Click *Release* and fill the field *Version name* with the value *1.0*.

h3. Expected Results
The issue *KAN-1* is no longer shown in the board.

h3. Actual Results
Issue *KAN-1* will be displayed on the board under the *Done* column.

h3.Workaround
# Review the issues still being displayed in the *Done* column and take note of their values of *Fix Version*.
# Navigate to the board's *Releases* page and filter by *Archived*.
# For every archived version retrieved from step 1, do the following:
## Unarchive the version.
## Releast the version.
## Archive the version back.
fields.summary: Issues are not cleared from the Done column in a Kanban board after releasing the version due to belonging to archived versions

I face the following challenge in our JIRA implementation:

We have a corporate MS Active Directory, that we have integrated with JIRA using the User Directory feature.  This sync is configured as ReadOnly with Local Groups and is mainly meant to get all employees into the jira-users group.

fields.description:
*Behaviour*

When plugin faces exceptional on DB connectivity during startup it will throw the same exception all the time plugin tries to access DB. 

Sample exception may look as follows:
{code:java}
2017-08-18 02:44:07,275 ajp-nio-127.0.0.1-8009-exec-25 WARN - 164x48697x1 8ne8wt 10.167.104.246 /browse/***** [c.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess] Unable to run plugin code because of 'java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException - null'.
2017-08-18 02:44:07,316 ajp-nio-127.0.0.1-8009-exec-25 ERROR - 164x48697x1 8ne8wt 10.167.104.246 /browse/****** [c.a.j.web.component.ModuleWebComponentImpl] An exception occured while rendering the web panel: com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:greenhopper-agile-issue-web-panel (null)
java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy3133.getSprint(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.sprint.SprintCFType.convertDbValueToType(SprintCFType.java:459)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.sprint.SprintCFType.convertDbValueToType(SprintCFType.java:83)
...
Caused by: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
...
java.sql.SQLException: ORA-00054: resource busy and acquire with NOWAIT specified or timeout expired
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.EntityManagedActiveObjects.migrate(EntityManagedActiveObjects.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.AbstractActiveObjectsFactory$1.doInTransaction(AbstractActiveObjectsFactory.java:77)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.AbstractActiveObjectsFactory$1.doInTransaction(AbstractActiveObjectsFactory.java:72)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.transaction.HostContextTransactionTemplate$1.doInTransaction(HostContextTransactionTemplate.java:21)
	at com.atlassian.jira.DefaultHostContextAccessor.doInTransaction(DefaultHostContextAccessor.java:34)
...
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.AbstractActiveObjectsFactory.create(AbstractActiveObjectsFactory.java:72)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.DelegatingActiveObjectsFactory.create(DelegatingActiveObjectsFactory.java:32)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.TenantAwareActiveObjects$1$1$1.call(TenantAwareActiveObjects.java:91)
	... 6 more
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: ORA-00054: resource busy and acquire with NOWAIT specified or timeout expired
...
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.executeUpdateInternal(OracleStatement.java:1845)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.executeUpdate(OracleStatement.java:1810)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatementWrapper.executeUpdate(OracleStatementWrapper.java:294)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingStatement.java:234)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingStatement.java:234)
	at net.java.ao.DatabaseProvider.executeUpdate(DatabaseProvider.java:2238)
	at net.java.ao.DatabaseProvider.executeUpdateForAction(DatabaseProvider.java:2294)
	at net.java.ao.DatabaseProvider.executeUpdatesForActions(DatabaseProvider.java:2266)
	at net.java.ao.schema.SchemaGenerator.migrate(SchemaGenerator.java:91)
	at net.java.ao.EntityManager.migrate(EntityManager.java:128)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.EntityManagedActiveObjects.migrate(EntityManagedActiveObjects.java:51)
	... 45 more{code}
*Root cause*

When exception occurs in AO initialisation code it will be cached and returned always. This is effectively breaking all communication with DB for plugin. This is happening in TenantAwareActiveObjects: class as aoPromisesByTenant is caching exception from initialisation. 

*Expected behaviour*

Plugin retries SQL and exception is not permanent. Or Jira is not starting and not allowing plugin to operate without DB connection.

*Workaround*

Restart Jira.
fields.summary: Wrong initialisation of plugin active objects causes permanent errors on SQL queries

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

If you have running parallel sprints from different projects that share the same board, issues in a sprint from Project A that are completed after the beginning of the parallel sprint of the Project B will be moved to the next sprint on the Epic Burndown report even when these sprints are parallel sprints and shouldn't be sharing issues at all.

h3. Description

For example: You have a board "Atlassian" that has a filter including several projects. You go to the Epic Burndown report and look for an epic "Atlassian: Epic 10".
Now, you'll be able to track how many sprints are required to complete the epic. You'll look then for Team Green Sprint 27 and Team Red Sprint 27 that appears on this report. For this epic, only Team Green Sprint 27 had issues worked and completed on for this epic, Team Red Sprint has nothing to do with this Epic, but appears on this report as it's project is included in the filter for this board. These two sprints are parallel sprints.

Sprint's created and end dates:
"Team Green Sprint 27" 14/09 17:00 - 28/09 17:00
 "Team Red Sprint 27" 14/09 17:57 - 28/09 17:59

*Expected:*
Issues would appear under sprint "Team Green Sprint 27" normally.

*Current behaviour:*
Issues are all appearing under "Team Red Sprint 27" even though they were never worked on this sprint neither have sub-tasks related to this sprint.

*Cause:*
In the "In the 'Completed Issues' table, why are some issues grouped into sprints that they are not assigned to?" question on this documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/using-a-board/using-reports/viewing-the-epic-burndown# it says that if an issue assigned to Sprint 1 is completed after the start date of Sprint 2, this issue will appear on the Epic Burndown report grouped with Sprint 2 issues.

So, given the create and end dates of each Sprint in the given example above, issues that were created on the "Team Green Sprint 27" sprint that were closed after 17:57 (create date of "Team Red Sprint 27"), were moved to the next sprint of the period that the issue was closed, in that case, "Team Red Sprint 27", even though this sprint is from a different project that didn't work with the Epic we're looking at.

However, this shouldn't work like this when you have parallel sprints from different projects that shares the same board but have nothing to do with each other.

On the Sprint Report and elsewhere on Jira, it shows the correct associated data. Just the Epic Burndown report that messes with the data, including the story points too on the Epic Report.

h3. Workaround

Create another board specific to the projects that the Epic will be working on.
fields.summary: Epic Burndown report incorrectly "moves" issues to the next sprint because of completed date even through parallel sprints of different projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Boards issue detail view no longer shows "Add Link" button as it did in previous versions
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira Software on a 7.1.x version (7.1.6 or 7.1.9 for example)
 # See that the issue details view does have this Issue link section of the page and a distinct "Add Link" button on this page
 # Upgrade Jira Software to 7.2.0 or higher
 # Check issue detail view again for this button

h3. Expected Results

Would still expect this button to exist on that page in the same way
h3. Actual Results

This button and section appear to have been removed from this specific view starting with Jira Software 7.2.0 and higher.

!issuedetailview71x.png|thumbnail!

!issuedetailview74x.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

Customer reported this as a regression when testing upgrade from 7.1.6 to 7.4.3. I found that my 7.1.9 version also contained this view, but that the default Jira Software 7.2.0 versions do not have this specific view.
h3. Workaround

You can still add links in the issue detail view. However in order to do this you would need to click the ... (More) menu button and select the Link option.
fields.summary: Boards issue detail view no longer shows "Add Link" button as it did in previous versions

h3. Summary

When in the Backlog or Active Sprint view of an agile board and viewing an issue, attempting to attach a file via the *More Actions* option in the *Actions* (ellipsis) menu at the top right of the pane will fail with a JS exception. Choosing the *Attach files* option directly via the *Actions* menu _without_ going through the *More Actions" option works without issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Navigate to a board's backlog or active sprint view
2. Click on an issue to view it in the issue detail view pane
3. Click the *Actions* ellipsis
4. Choose the *More Actions...* option
5. Select *Attach files*
6. Select any file and click on *Open*. Observe error.

h3. Expected Results
File should be attached without issue.

h3. Actual Results

{code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Upgrading Jira from version prior to 7.4 to 7.6+ causes DVCS to fail on MS SQL environments
h3. Environment
 * Jira 7.6.0
 * Jira database is using a MS SQL server on the backend such as 2012 or 2014

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This problem can be reproduced by
 # Install previous version of Jira such as 7.1.9 or 7.2.x
 # Use a MS SQL 2012 database
 # connect Jira to a bitbucket or github repo using the DVCS connector
 # upgrade Jira to 7.6.0

h3. Expected Results

DVCS works
h3. Actual Results

DVCS stops working, and the logs have errors such as:
{code:java}
Caught SQLServerException for select "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."ID", "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."ADDRESS", "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."PAYLOAD", "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."PAYLOAD_TYPE", "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."PRIORITY", max("AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE_QUEUE_ITEM"."RETRIES_COUNT") as "RETRIES_COUNT" from "dbo"."AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE" "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE" left join "dbo"."AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE_QUEUE_ITEM" "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE_QUEUE_ITEM" on "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."ID" = "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE_QUEUE_ITEM"."MESSAGE_ID" where "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."ID" = ? group by "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."ID", "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."ADDRESS", "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."PAYLOAD", "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."PAYLOAD_TYPE", "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."PRIORITY"
com.querydsl.core.QueryException: Caught SQLServerException for select "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."ID", "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."ADDRESS", "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."PAYLOAD", "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."PAYLOAD_TYPE", "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."PRIORITY", max("AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE_QUEUE_ITEM"."RETRIES_COUNT") as "RETRIES_COUNT" from "dbo"."AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE" "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE" left join "dbo"."AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE_QUEUE_ITEM" "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE_QUEUE_ITEM" on "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."ID" = "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE_QUEUE_ITEM"."MESSAGE_ID" where "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."ID" = ? group by "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."ID", "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."ADDRESS", "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."PAYLOAD", "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."PAYLOAD_TYPE", "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE"."PRIORITY" 
{code}
The more telling error is:
{code:java}
Caused by: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The text, ntext, and image data types cannot be compared or sorted, except when using IS NULL or LIKE operator. 
{code}
Which appears to indicate that the DVCS is trying to make a SQL comparison/sort that is not possible in MS SQL
h3. Notes

 
h3. Workaround
 * Manually update all columns in table AO_E8B6CC_% from ntext to nvarchar(max)
fields.summary: Upgrading Jira to 7.6 causes DVCS to fail on MS SQL environments

No workaround

fields.description: The Burndown Chart report provides an estimation statistic pulldown, which allows you to display a burndown with a different estimation statistic from the one set in the board configuration. We configure our boards with Story Points as the estimation statistic, so that we can track velocity sprint over sprint, but we have the option of displaying a different burndown by choosing a custom field as the estimation statistic on the Burndown Chart. This helps us track progress within the sprint. Adding this functionality to the gadget would allow us to display it on a wallboard, which would help to make this valuable information more visible.

*Issue Summary*
 * When cluster in mixmode and all the nodes are in new version, restarting the cluster (shutting down and starting up) will bring us into mode where nodes can't be started because of the version launcher check which has empty list of life nodes. 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Strat ZDU process
 # Restart one node before finishing ZDU 

*Expected Behavior*
 * Jira should start up normally, and admin should be able to finish ZDU process

*Actual Behavior*
 * Jira is not starting up

*Workaround*
 # Add additional node to cluster. Make sure that Jira version on new node is not new one.
 # Start Jira (it will start normally)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As mentioned by the developer in this JRA-59832 ticket:
{quote}Unfortunately it was becoming too difficult to maintain older upgrade tasks, so in 7.1.0 the Agile team removed upgrade tasks older than 12 months.
You can either
Upgrade JIRA Agile to 6.7.x on their original instance (for JIRA 6.3, 6.4 and 6.5). Or;
Import the data into a JIRA Software 7.0.0 instance first. (or upgrade the original instance to 7.0.0)
Both of these scenarios will run the required upgrade tasks.{quote}

So currently,when user want to take "Roll back" action, he must prepare
# backup of JIRA Installation Directory
# backup of JIRA HOME directory
# backup of JIRA Database directory
So if user missed those backups, user can't take this action.
User can notice after upgrade by atlassian-jira.log because no error/warning on before upgrade process.(https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-60371)

In 7.1.4, there are 
{code}
(ghUpgradeTask046)	Assign status categories to Agile Simplified Workflow statuses.
(ghUpgradeTask047)	Remove classic gadget
(ghUpgradeTask048)	Inserts a reindex required warning into the admin screen for the epic label custom field searching
(ghUpgradeTask049)	Migration Manage Sprints permission
(ghUpgradeTask050)	Re-migration Manage Sprints permission
(ghUpgradeTask051)	Migration Manage Sprints permission for BTF customers only
{code}

And in 7.0.10,
{code}
(ghUpgradeTask003)	Moves some preferences values to settings
(ghUpgradeTask004)	Layout Keys Upgrade Task
(ghUpgradeTask007)	Flag Field Value Upgrade Task
(ghUpgradeTask008)	Listener Removal Upgrade Task
(ghUpgradeTask009)	GreenHopper Nightservice cleanup Task
(ghUpgradeTask010)	Custom Field Reindex Message
(ghUpgradeTask011)	Custom Field Reindex Message
(ghUpgradeTask012)	Labs Ranking Migration
(ghUpgradeTask013)	Ranking Migration
(ghUpgradeTask014)	Introduction of UpgradeVersionService
(ghUpgradeTask015)	Migrating Sprint data from PropertySets back into AO
(ghUpgradeTask016)	Migrating RapidView data from PropertySets back into AO
(ghUpgradeTask017)	Setting default Estimation Statistic configuration for boards
(ghUpgradeTask018)	Setting default Estimation Statistic configuration for boards
(ghUpgradeTask019)	Setting sprint field reindex required message
(ghUpgradeTask020)	Setting default swimlane strategy for boards
(ghUpgradeTask021)	Setting default Tracking Statistic configuration for boards
(ghUpgradeTask022)	Attempt to create Sprint custom field as Scrum is no longer a 'Labs' feature
(ghUpgradeTask023)	Setting default card color strategy for boards
(ghUpgradeTask024)	Fixes default sprint marker names in the database
(ghUpgradeTask025)	Renames the Epic Label field to Epic Name
(ghUpgradeTask026)	Adds custom fields for Epic support
(ghUpgradeTask027)	Updating epic status custom field value based on the current resolution of the epic
(ghUpgradeTask029)	Modifying change history items for Epic Link field to include issue ID
(ghUpgradeTask030)	Inserts a reindex required warning into the admin screen for the epic label custom field
(ghUpgradeTask031)	Migrate default issue details fields into configuration
(ghUpgradeTask032)	Updating stored usernames to work with JIRA 6.0 rename user feature
(ghUpgradeTask033)	Merge data from duplicated custom fields of managed GreenHopper custom fields
(ghUpgradeTask034)	Add epic link custom field to default screen
(ghUpgradeTask035)	Update searcher type for Flagged custom field
(ghUpgradeTask036)	Set started flag of existing sprints to true
(ghUpgradeTask037)	Renamed custom fields and work flows for JIRA Agile
(ghUpgradeTask038)	Reset Analytics opt in values
(ghUpgradeTask039)	Upgrade Rapid View owners to Board Admins
(ghUpgradeTask040)	Reset custom field names
(ghUpgradeTask041)	Update epic color to the new palette
(ghUpgradeTask042)	Add sprint field to view/create/edit issue screens
(ghUpgradeTask043)	Force Sprint Marker Migration
(ghUpgradeTask044)	Migrate to lexo rank
(ghUpgradeTask045)	Remove 'Rank (Obsolete)' custom fields
(ghUpgradeTask046)	Assign status categories to Agile Simplified Workflow statuses.
(ghUpgradeTask047)	Remove classic gadget.
(ghUpgradeTask048)	Inserts a reindex required warning into the admin screen for the epic label custom field searching
(ghUpgradeTask049)	Upgrade task to bring build number in sync with cloud
(ghUpgradeTask050)	Upgrade task to bring build number in sync with cloud
{code}

Error message shows us that 
# JIRA 6.3.15&JIRA Agile 6.3.13 is "ghUpgradeTask042"
# JIRA Software 7.1.x starts its upgrade task from "ghUpgradeTask045"

So ghUpgradeTasks from 043 to 044 are removed.


h3. Suggested Solution
Publish some document or script to do JIRA Agile upgrade task that removed by the development team. The documentation should include about the things such like DB tables/record that are changed by these upgradetask. This would be easier than performing the rollback process.
fields.summary: Documentation/Script request on the removed Jira Agile Upgrade Task

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently , in [JIRA Software 7.0 upgrade|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-0-x-upgrade-notes-824352098.html] documentation mention about upgrade path {{JIRA 5.1 OR EARLIER → JIRA 5.2 OR LATER → JIRA SOFTWARE 7.0}} . But , in [JIRA Software 7.1.x upgrade notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-1-x-upgrade-notes-815266963.html] mention :-
{panel}
(?) The recommended, intermediary upgrade version is necessary due to upgrade tasks that were removed in JIRA Software 7.1.0.
As an alternative, you can upgrade to an intermediary version of JIRA Agile (any version from 6.4.5 to 6.7.12), which includes the upgrade tasks that were removed.
{panel}

It's confusing because we recommend customer upgrade to the latest version of JIRA Agile in order to prevent any problem . 

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the  [JIRA Software 7.0 upgrade|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-0-x-upgrade-notes-824352098.html] documentation , to follow the same upgrade path as [JIRA Software 7.1.x upgrade notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-1-x-upgrade-notes-815266963.html]
fields.summary: JIRA Software 7.0 upgrade documentation information inconsistent with 7.1 documentation
